name: linuron
source: Hughes LD; Palmer DS; Nigsch F and Mitchell JBO. 2008 Why are some properties more difficult to predict than others? A study of QSPR models of solubility; melting point and LogP. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2008. 48 (1). pp 220?460
Reason: 1,2,3,4,5,6-Hexachlorocyclohexane, such as linuron, has a melting point influenced by its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The chlorine atoms increase the melting point due to their strong electronegativity and ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +10 °C for each chlorine. The cyclohexane ring introduces significant rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 °C for each additional fused ring. The nitrogen atom also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +5 °C.
